params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the location to archive.

description:
The `archiveLocation()` function changes a location's `archived` property to `true`.

> **Notes:**
> + A location's `status` isn't affected by this function.
> + An archived location can't be updated.
> + It's currently not possible to unarchive locations.
> + A `default` location can't be archived.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Archive a location
body: console.log('The following location has been archived', archivedLocation);

extra.description: This code uses the value of user's chosen location from a dropdown on the page and archives it.

description: This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Create a new location @description:
body: *         comment: 'Half price in the lead up to Christmas!',
*   description: 'Our brand new location in London City Center!',
*         "comment": "Half price in the lead up to Christmas!",
*   "description": "Our brand new location in London City Center!",

examples.title: Create a new location from input on the site's page
body: console.log('You have successfully created a new location.\n', newLocation);

extra.description: This code takes the values a user inputs into a form on the page, and uses them as the values for the properties of a new location. This page is accessible to only company managers so they can add locations to the database.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the location to retrieve.

description:
Retrieves a location by the specified location ID.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

examples.title: Get a location
body: console.log('Here are the details of the location:', myLocation);
*   "description": "Our brand new, budget store in the heart of Mexico City!",

examples.title: Get a location's properties
body: console.log('Here are the details of the location:', myLocation);

extra.description: This code uses the value of user's chosen location from a dropdown on the page and retrieves all of the location's information.

examples.title: Archive a location
body: console.log('The following location has been archived', archivedLocation);

extra.description: This code uses the value of user's chosen location from a dropdown on the page and archives it.

params.name: options
params.doc: Options to use when retrieving a list of locations.

description:
Retrieves a list of up to 1,000 locations, given the provided filters, sorting, and paging.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of up to 1,000 locations.
description: The `queryLocations()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of locations and returns a [`LocationsQueryBuilder`](#locationsquerybuilder) object.
The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](#locationsquerybuilder/find) function.

You can refine the query by chaining `LocationsQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `LocationsQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryLocations()` returns. The functions that are chained to `queryLocations()` are applied in the order they are called.
`queryLocations()` runs with the following `LocationsQueryBuilder` defaults that you can override:

The following `QueryLocationsBuilder` functions are supported for the `queryLocations()` function. For a full description of the Locations object, see the object returned for the [`items`](#locationsqueryresult/items) property in [`LocationsQueryResult`](#locationsqueryresult).

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the location to set as the default location.

description:
Sets a new default location.

> **Notes:**
> + There can only be one default location per site.
> + The default location can't be archived.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

Replaces a location.

> **Note:**
> + Currently, it isn't possible to partially update a location. You must pass the full location object in the `location` parameter.

This function is not a universal function and runs only on the backend.

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: Code for a subdivision (such as state, prefecture, or province) in [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2) format.

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude of the location. Must be between -90 and 90.

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude of the location. Must be between -180 and 180.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the location to archive.

members.name: periods
members.doc: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.

description: Business schedule. Regular and exceptional time periods when the business is open or the service is available.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the location to retrieve.

members.name: includeArchived
members.doc:
Whether to include `archived` locations in the response.

Default: `false`

members.name: includeArchived
members.doc:
Whether to include `archived` locations in the response.

Default: `false`

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated.

__Note:__ [Archiving a location](#archivelocation)
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.

Supported values: `BRANCH`, `OFFICES`, `RECEPTION`, `HEADQUARTERS`.

**Note**: This field is currently not supported.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status.

Supported values: `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`.

Default: `ACTIVE`

__Notes:__
- [Archiving a location](#archivelocation)
doesn't affect the location's status.
- `INACTIVE` status is currently not supported.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to load.

Default: `50`

Max: `1000`

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

Default: `0`

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: query
members.doc: Information about the filters, sorting, and paging.

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the location to set as the default location.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: comment
members.doc: Additional info about the exception. For example, "We close earlier on New Year's Eve."

members.name: endDate
members.doc: End date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

members.name: isClosed
members.doc:
Whether the business is closed (or the service is not available) during the exception.

Default: `true`.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Start date and time of the exception in [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format and [Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time).

description: Exception to the business's regular hours. The business can be open or closed during the exception.
Street address. Includes street name, number, and apartment number in separate fields.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time the period ends in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

__Note:__ If `openDay` and `closeDay` specify the same day of the week `closeTime` must be later than `openTime`.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week the period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time the period starts in 24-hour [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) extended format. Valid values are `00:00` to `24:00`, where `24:00` represents
midnight at the end of the specified day.

description: Weekly recurring time periods when the business is regularly open or the service is available.

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Whether the location is archived. Archived locations can't be updated.

__Note:__ [Archiving a location](#archivelocation)
doesn't affect its `status`.

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Business schedule. Array of weekly recurring time periods when the location is open for business. Limited to 100 time periods.

__Note:__ Not supported by Wix Bookings.

members.name: default
members.doc: Whether this is the default location. There can only be one default location per site. The default location can't be archived.

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
Location type.

Supported values: `BRANCH`, `OFFICES`, `RECEPTION`, `HEADQUARTERS`.

**Note**: This field is currently not supported.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by 1 each time the location is updated.
To prevent conflicting changes, the existing revision must be used when updating a location.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Location status.

Supported values: `ACTIVE`, `INACTIVE`.

Default: `ACTIVE`

__Notes:__
- [Archiving a location](#archivelocation)
doesn't affect the location's status.
- `INACTIVE` status is currently not supported.
